Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay, let me start by understanding the normative process first. The process starts with receiving an order. Then it checks inventory. Depending on whether theres enough stock, two paths are possible: either proceed normally (check inventory -> authorize payment -> package -> ship -> close) or cancel (check inventory -> cancel -> close).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1: It follows the normal path perfectly. Receive, check, authorize, package, ship, close in order. No issues here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 seems to have a problem because after checking inventory, they package items first before authorizing payment. According to the description, authorization should come before packaging. Thats a violation here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3: After canceling the order, they shipped it anyway? The normative process says shipping shouldnt happen after cancellation. This is definitely a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 follows the cancellation path correctlyâ€”after checking inventory and finding insufficient stock, they cancel and then close. No issues here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 5 skips authorizing payment altogether. The description states that authorization must be done before packaging and shipping. Since they went straight to ship order without authorizing payment first, this is a violation as well.
